connectfour

Class ConnectFour

  • java.lang.Object
    • connectfour.ConnectFour

  • public class ConnectFour
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the ConnectFour class. This class contains all the necessary methods for playing a game of connect four with two players or a player and the computer. It contains 4 GUI stages and 3 of them are the settings for the game and the other is the game itself.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ConnectFour.Cell
      This is the Cell class that holds the one game cell It also has a JButton coming with it so every single game cell is also a button.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Image blueDot
      Image of the blue player.
      private java.awt.Image blueDotWin
      Image of the blue player when it is one of the cells that caused the victory.
      private int boardSize
      The size of the game board as well as each dimension of the gameCells variable.
      private int currentPlayer
      0 if the first player is playing and 1 if the second player is playing.
      private ConnectFour.Cell[][] gameCells
      Array of Cell classes and it holds all the cells that are being used in the game.
      private boolean isComputerGoFirst
      Is the computer playing first or the player.
      private boolean isGameEnded
      Has the game reached an end status.
      private boolean isVsComputer
      Is the game being played against the computer or another player.
      private javax.swing.JFrame menuFrame
      Main windows that holds all the buttons, labels etc.
      private java.awt.Image redDot
      Image of the red player.
      private java.awt.Image redDotWin
      Image of the red player when it is one of the cells that caused the victory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectFour()
      No parameter constructor, loads up the image files and sets the fields to initial values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int allMoveVals(int startX, int startY, int playerMove)
      Since each move can bring a player closer to winning by one of the four cases(vertical, horizontal, diagonal left to right and diagonal right to left), this method takes a cell that being played imaginary by computer and calculates its effectiveness on that four cases.
      (package private) int calcMoveVal(int pointX, int pointY, int xIncrease, int yIncrease, int maxValueCurrentMove, int playerMove)
      Starts at a point, increases result value by one if a friendly cell is in sight and decreases result value by two if a adversary cell is in sight and changes to another cell by xIncrease and yIncrease variables.
      private void checkWin()
      Controls every possible win or draw condition and if it finds one, ends the game with an information message and restarts the game afterwards.
      private void inGame()
      Creates the necessary components for the main window that the actual game is being played.
      private void play()
      Plays a move for the computer.
      private void play(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Plays a move for the player based on the button that the player clicked.
      void playGame()
      Calls the first GUI stage that brings out the game type selection window.
      private void readBoardSize()
      Creates the necessary components for the window that the board size input being taken.
      private void readGameType()
      Creates the necessary components for the window that asks the player if it wants to play against another player or the computer.
      private void readStartingPlayer()
      Creates the necessary components for the window that asks if the computer or the player goes first in the Player VS Computer game mode.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • gameCells

        private ConnectFour.Cell[][] gameCells
        Array of Cell classes and it holds all the cells that are being used in the game.

      • boardSize

        private int boardSize
        The size of the game board as well as each dimension of the gameCells variable.

      • currentPlayer

        private int currentPlayer
        0 if the first player is playing and 1 if the second player is playing. This variable decides who is the winner and which kind of cell should the game place on a button click.

      • isVsComputer

        private boolean isVsComputer
        Is the game being played against the computer or another player.

      • isGameEnded

        private boolean isGameEnded
        Has the game reached an end status.

      • isComputerGoFirst

        private boolean isComputerGoFirst
        Is the computer playing first or the player.

      • menuFrame

        private javax.swing.JFrame menuFrame
        Main windows that holds all the buttons, labels etc. This JFrame is being cleared each time another state of GUI is reached.

      • blueDot

        private java.awt.Image blueDot
        Image of the blue player.

      • blueDotWin

        private java.awt.Image blueDotWin
        Image of the blue player when it is one of the cells that caused the victory.

      • redDot

        private java.awt.Image redDot
        Image of the red player.

      • redDotWin

        private java.awt.Image redDotWin
        Image of the red player when it is one of the cells that caused the victory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectFour

        ConnectFour()
        No parameter constructor, loads up the image files and sets the fields to initial values.

    • Method Detail

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Calls the first GUI stage that brings out the game type selection window. It is simpler to use this method from another method.

      • readGameType

        private void readGameType()
        Creates the necessary components for the window that asks the player if it wants to play against another player or the computer. Changes fields according to the button press and advances to the next game state after that.

      • readStartingPlayer

        private void readStartingPlayer()
        Creates the necessary components for the window that asks if the computer or the player goes first in the Player VS Computer game mode. Changes variables according to the button that pressed and advances to the next game state after that.

      • readBoardSize

        private void readBoardSize()
        Creates the necessary components for the window that the board size input being taken. Controls errors for invalid inputs and changes variables according to the given input and advances to the game state after that.

      • inGame

        private void inGame()
        Creates the necessary components for the main window that the actual game is being played. Also plays a move for the computer if the "Computer Goes First" option is selected in the game menu.

      • play

        private void play(int rowIndex,
                  int colIndex)
        Plays a move for the player based on the button that the player clicked.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - row index of the button that the player clicked
        colIndex - column index of the button that the player clicked

      • calcMoveVal

        int calcMoveVal(int pointX,
                int pointY,
                int xIncrease,
                int yIncrease,
                int maxValueCurrentMove,
                int playerMove)
        Starts at a point, increases result value by one if a friendly cell is in sight and decreases result value by two if a adversary cell is in sight and changes to another cell by xIncrease and yIncrease variables.
        Parameters:
        pointX - starting x coordinate
        pointY - starting y coordinate
        xIncrease - in which direction should the x coordinate change
        yIncrease - in which direction should the y coordinate change
        maxValueCurrentMove - current maximum value of the moves calculated before this call
        playerMove - is the AI being played by player 1 or player 2
        Returns:
        maximum effectiveness of the possible cases

      • allMoveVals

        private int allMoveVals(int startX,
                        int startY,
                        int playerMove)
        Since each move can bring a player closer to winning by one of the four cases(vertical, horizontal, diagonal left to right and diagonal right to left), this method takes a cell that being played imaginary by computer and calculates its effectiveness on that four cases.
        Parameters:
        startX - starting x coordinate of the control
        startY - starting y coordinate of the control
        playerMove - is the AI being played as player 1 or player 2
        Returns:
        maximum effectiveness of the possible cases

      • play

        private void play()
        Plays a move for the computer. Calculates "value" of every possible move it can make using helper methods and decides on a cell.

      • checkWin

        private void checkWin()
        Controls every possible win or draw condition and if it finds one, ends the game with an information message and restarts the game afterwards.
